meanings.definition: A system of signaling using flags or lights
meanings.sent1: The sailors used semaphores to send messages across the sea.
meanings.sent2: The military base had a network of semaphores for communication.
meanings.sent3: During the flag semaphore competition, the wind kept blowing the flags in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent4: The semaphores on the runway guided the pilot safely to the airport.
meanings.sent5: The colorful semaphores fluttered in the breeze, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.definition: A visual signaling device used in communication
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse beacon acted as a semaphore to warn ships of danger.
meanings.sent2: The semaphore on the train track indicated when it was safe to cross.
meanings.sent3: The semaphore at the intersection malfunctioned, causing confusion among drivers.
meanings.sent4: Her waving hand served as a semaphore to catch her friend's attention.
meanings.sent5: The semaphore tower stood tall, overlooking the bustling city below.

meanings.sent1: The scouts semaphored their location to the rescue team.
meanings.sent2: They semaphored back and forth to coordinate their movements.
meanings.sent3: In the game of charades, players semaphored clues to their teammates.
meanings.sent4: The dancers semaphored their emotions through graceful movements.
meanings.sent5: The old friends semaphored across the crowded room, sharing a secret message.
